summary: Email from defense attorney Bobbi C. Sternheim to the Bureau of Prisons regarding her client Ghislaine Maxwell. Sternheim urgently requests legal phone calls to replace in-person visits that were canceled because Maxwell was placed in quarantine due to COVID-19 exposure.

persons.name: Bobbi C. Sternheim
persons.context: Attorney representing Ghislaine Maxwell; sends urgent email to Bureau of Prisons requesting legal calls after Maxwell is placed in quarantine.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Client of Bobbi C. Sternheim; identified as inmate 02879-509; placed in quarantine due to contact with a COVID-19 infected corrections officer.

persons.name: Achal Fernando-Peiris
persons.context: Recipient (Cc) of the email from attorney Bobbi C. Sternheim regarding legal visit scheduling for Ghislaine Maxwell.

connections.description: Sternheim identifies herself as counsel for Maxwell and is advocating for legal communication access on her behalf.

events.title: Legal Visit Scheduling
events.description: Bureau of Prisons confirms scheduling of legal visits for Ghislaine Maxwell with her attorney Bobbi C. Sternheim for November 21 and 28, 2020.

events.title: Maxwell Placed in Quarantine
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell is placed in quarantine at the correctional facility due to contact with a corrections officer who tested positive for COVID-19.

events.title: Requested Legal Call
events.description: Attorney Bobbi C. Sternheim requests a legal phone call from 12:30 PM to 3:00 PM to replace the canceled in-person visit due to Maxwell's quarantine.

events.title: Requested Legal Call
events.description: Attorney Bobbi C. Sternheim requests a second legal phone call from 12:30 PM to 3:00 PM to replace the canceled in-person visit scheduled for November 28.

keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell was placed in quarantine in November 2020 after contact with a COVID-19 infected corrections officer.
Her defense attorney, Bobbi C. Sternheim, urgently requested legal phone calls to replace canceled in-person visits due to the quarantine.
The document shows the operational challenges and communication protocols between defense counsel and the Bureau of Prisons during the COVID-19 pandemic.
